title: Eurovision stars complete BBC quiz
description: Mae Muller, Victor Vernicos and Gustaph answer six Eurovision questions.

title: Sudan conflict: Grandmother died trapped by fighting in Khartoum
description: Alaweya Reshwan died alone at home in Khartoum, trapped by the fighting that is tearing Sudan apart.

title: Bellator 296: Fabian Edwards beats Gegard Mousasi in Paris to set up middleweight title shot
description: Fabian Edwards beats Gegard Mousasi by unanimous decision at Bellator 296 in Paris to set up a middleweight title fight against champion Johnny Eblen.

title: Eurovision grand final: A mystery guest, and nine more things to look for
description: With trampolines, mystery guests and a "green cabbage worm", Eurovision promises a night of mayhem.

title: The Papers: 'We three kings' and 'Phil fights for job'
description: Phillip Schofield's position at This Morning and a new Coronation picture lead Saturday's papers.

title: Kidney: Would you donate an organ to a stranger?
description: One woman decided to give her kidney straight after hearing an interview on the radio.

title: Jordan Neely: What happened in NYC subway chokehold case?
description: Video shows Daniel Penny with his arms around Jordan Neely's neck for about two minutes and 55 seconds.

title: Imran Khan's dramatic arrest saga... in under 90 seconds
description: Pakistan's former prime minister has faced months of legal troubles and attempts to arrest him.

title: Peterborough United 4-0 Sheffield Wednesday: Posh crush Owls to take control of play-off tie
description: Peterborough United thrash Sheffield Wednesday 4-0 to take a commanding lead in their League One play-off semi-final.

title: NFL: Washington Commanders co-owner Dan Snyder agrees record £4.8bn sale to Josh Harris
description: Washington Commanders co-owner Dan Snyder agrees to sell the NFL franchise to a group headed by Josh Harris in a record £4.8bn deal.

title: Jamie Foxx out of hospital and recuperating, daughter says
description: Corinne Foxx says the Oscar-winning actor is recuperating and even recently played pickleball.

title: Coronation photo shows King Charles with Prince William and Prince George
description: Official photo shows the King with his elder son and grandson, who are next in line to the throne.

title: Train strikes: Passengers face second day of industrial action
description: RMT union members from 14 rail companies will walk-out on Saturday in a row over pay.

title: Skipton: Will deposit-free mortgages help budding first-time buyers?
description: Will Skipton Building Society's deposit-free deal help those hoping to buy in the lender's home town?

title: Queen's Park 0-4 Partick Thistle (agg 3-8): Jags advance to face Ayr United
description: Partick Thistle will play Ayr United in the Scottish Premiership play-off semi-final after an 8-3 aggregate win over Queen's Park.

title: Officials advised Braverman against RAF base asylum plan
description: Civil servants told the home secretary to halt plans to house asylum seekers at the Lincolnshire site.

title: Porthmadog: Police officer suspended after punching video
description: North Wales Police says it has suspended an officer who was filmed seemingly punching a suspect.

title: Woman in coma after Earl's Court royal police escort crash - family
description: A police motorcycle was escorting the Duchess of Edinburgh when the crash happened, police say.

title: Government defends Year 6 tests as 'meant to be hard'
description: An English reading paper fuels debate about the purpose of the tests for Year 6 pupils in England.

title: Teen's terror plot against police and soldiers thwarted by mother
description: Islamist militant Matthew King faces sentence for planning attacks on British soldiers and police.

title: Julian Nagelsmann: Former Bayern Munich boss will not be next Tottenham manager
description: Former Bayern Munich boss Julian Nagelsmann will not be the next manager of Tottenham, BBC Sport understands.

title: Wild lion Loonkiito, 'one of the world's oldest', killed in Kenya
description: "Symbol of resilience" Loonkiito was killed after preying on livestock in a Kenyan village on Wednesday.

title: 'A pasta sandwich?!' - Sam Kerr's secret to success
description: Chelsea forward Sam Kerr reveals the secret superstitions which help her succeed on a matchday, including a strange-sounding pre-match meal.

title: Linda Yaccarino: Twitter CEO rumours circle as ad boss leaves NBCUniversal
description: Linda Yaccarino's departure follows Elon Musk's announcement that he has found a new boss for Twitter.

title: U-turn over MP Joanna Cherry's cancelled Edinburgh Fringe show
description: The venue which axed SNP MP Joanna Cherry's event in a row over her views on transgender issues has apologised.

title: Harry and others 'long way off' proving hacking claims, Mirror publisher says
description: The paper's publisher says evidence is non-existent while defending itself at the High Court.

title: Eurovision: Ukraine's Zelensky should address contest, says Rishi Sunak
description: The organisers of the song contest turned down a request from Ukraine's president to speak.

title: Three teachers in hospital after Johnstone High School disturbance
description: The teachers and a 14-year-old pupil were injured in an incident at Johnstone High School.

title: Nikki Allan murder: David Boyd guilty of killing Sunderland girl
description: David Boyd lured Nikki Allan to a derelict building where he beat her with a brick and stabbed her.

title: Paul Clark: Former MP jailed over child abuse images
description: Former Labour MP Paul Clark represented Gillingham in Kent for 13 years.

title: Declan Rice: West Ham boss David Moyes accepts midfielder may leave
description: West Ham captain Declan Rice may leave at the end of the season, manager David Moyes admits.

title: Portuguese parliament votes to allow limited euthanasia
description: Doctors can now help people suffering from incurable diseases or severe injuries to end their lives.

title: Nikki Allan: A mother's 30-year search for her daughter's killer
description: Nikki Allan was lured to a brutal death in 1992, since that day her mother has searched for justice.

title: Pep Guardiola 'can't understand' scheduling of Man City fixtures
description: Pep Guardiola says he does not "understand" the scheduling of Manchester City's fixtures - but is beyond fighting against it.

title: Daniel Penny surrenders over NYC chokehold death of Jordan Neely
description: Daniel Penny, 24, faces up to 15 years if convicted of the death of 30-year-old Jordan Neely.

title: Labour takes sexual harassment extremely seriously, says Keir Starmer
description: The Labour leader faces questions about an investigation that found a senior party aide groped an intern.

title: Saracens v Northampton: Sarries' big-name players return for Premiership semi-final
description: Saracens recall their internationals for the Premiership semi-final against Northampton, with winger James Ramm starting for Saints.

title: Royal Mail boss to step down after tumultuous two years
description: Simon Thompson was under pressure after a long industrial dispute and accusations he had misled MPs.

title: Imran Khan to be released from custody in Pakistan, court rules
description: After being detained on Tuesday, Mr Khan cannot be re-arrested on corruption charges for two weeks.

title: Pope Francis warns pets must not replace children in Italy
description: Pope Francis warns only the rich can afford to start a family, as Italy's birth rate hits new low.

title: Mike Lynch: Autonomy founder extradited to US in criminal case
description: Mike Lynch is accused of overinflating the value of his firm Autonomy when he sold it to Hewlett-Packard.

title: Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby given speeding fine
description: Justin Welby admitted the offence and was given three penalty points at a magistrates' court.

title: Mae Muller surprised by Eurovision choir
description: During an interview with the BBC, a choir burst into song with her Eurovision entry, I Wrote A Song.

title: DP World Tour: Henrik Stenson resigns after LIV players hit with fines and bans
description: Former Open champion Henrik Stenson resigns from the DP World Tour after it imposed further sanctions on players who competed without consent in LIV Golf events.

title: Astronomers detect largest cosmic explosion ever seen
description: Astronomers have discovered what they believe to be the largest explosion ever detected.

title: Beyoncé Renaissance world tour: What to expect from Queen Bey
description: Fans who got to see the singer kick off her 43-date spectacular spill the beans on the "crazy" show.

title: Watch: CCTV captures funnel cloud rip through storage yard
description: CCTV captures mattresses and other heavy objects being tossed into the air, narrowly missing staff.

title: Erling Haaland and Sam Kerr win Football Writers' Association awards
description: Manchester City striker Erling Haaland and Chelsea's Sam Kerr have been named men's and women's footballer of the year by the Football Writers' Association (FWA).

title: Sudan conflict: Army and RSF agree deal to protect civilians
description: They agree to allow safe passage for civilians and to protect relief workers but not to a ceasefire.

title: NBA play-offs: Philadelphia 76ers' Joel Embiid makes huge block against Boston Celtics
description: Philadelphia 76ers' Joel Embiid makes a brilliant block against Jaylen Brown of the Boston Celtics in game six of the NBA Eastern Conference semi-final.

title: Phillip Schofield says recent weeks 'haven't been easy'
description: The presenter issues a statement following reports his relationship with Holly Willoughby has cooled.

title: Eurovision 2023: Austria to open Liverpool's song contest with UK closing
description: Producers have aimed for a show running order with pace, power and pizzazz for Saturday night.

title: Sale Sharks: Raffi Quirke and Sam James on Sale's fight for Manchester limelight
description: Sale take on Leicester this weekend knowing a Premiership final spot at stake. But spreading rugby in the north-west is a twin prize.

title: Guro Reiten: Meet Chelsea's 'baby-faced assassin' leading their trophy hunt
description: Meet Guro Reiten, Chelsea's unassuming but brilliant winger described as the "baby-faced assassin".

title: UK saw sluggish growth at start of year
description: Growth was just 0.1% in the first three months of the year, as the economy was affected by strike action.

title: The Christie: World-renowned NHS centre downgraded by watchdog
description: Inspectors praise The Christie's research and innovation but say staff are not always listened to.

title: NFL 2023 fixture release: Kansas City Chiefs to host Detroit Lions in season opener
description: The 2023 NFL season will begin with defending champions Kansas City Chiefs hosting the Detroit Lions on Thursday, 7 September.

title: North Devon surfers mark world status for area
description: Surfers celebrate north Devon joining Santa Cruz and Malibu as a World Surfing Reserve.

title: Efforts wasted, say students caught up in marking boycott
description: Students fear Edinburgh's response to industrial action will mean months of work will go unread.

title: Uneasy calm in El Paso, Texas as Title 42 comes to an end
description: As many as 60,000 migrants are believed to be waiting to cross into the US as Title 42 rules end.

title: YouTuber Trevor Jacob admits to crashing plane for views
description: Prosecutors say Trevor Jacob will plead guilty to obstructing an investigation by destroying the wreckage.

title: Australia government approves first new coal mine since elected
description: The government came to power a year ago promising greater action on climate change.

title: Eurovision 2023: Five times the US wowed Eurovision
description: Viewers worldwide will be able to vote for the first time but the US's role in the contest goes way back.

title: Ukraine war: WFP chief Cindy McCain says grain deal with Russia needed to feed world
description: Cindy McCain tells the BBC's Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg programme the deal must be renewed by 18 May.

title: Coronation: Royal fan held for 13 hours after being mistaken for protester
description: Alice Chambers was handcuffed on the Mall when police officers mistook her for a Just Stop Oil protester.

title: Wildfire smoke from Alberta and British Columbia reaches US
description: Satellite images show much of Canada and parts of US blanketed by smoke from the Alberta wildfires.

title: Hacker marketplace still active despite police 'takedown' claim
description: Police said the "dangerous" Genesis Market had been dismantled, but it is still selling hacker products.
